title: MYNIC aims for more entrepreneurs to use .my domain to boost biz
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): MYNIC Bhd, the agency that manages, administrates and promotes the use of the .my domain in Malaysia and internationally, plans to target more Malaysians, especially entrepreneurs, to use the domain to expand their business operations.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): MYNIC Bhd, the agency that manages, administrates and promotes the use of the .my domain in Malaysia and internationally, plans to target more Malaysians, especially entrepreneurs, to use the domain to expand their business operations.

MYNIC chief executive officer Datuk Hasnul Fadhly Hasan said there are currently 313,000 users of the domain, compared to the target of 400,000 users this year, with 150,000 users being companies and the rest being individuals and small-scale op

title: SIRIM QAS’ certification scheme accelerates Malaysia’s EV industry
summary: SIRIM QAS International, Malaysia's leading testing, inspection and certification body, is set to play a vital role in the electric vehicles (EV) industry via its electric vehicle charging system (EVCS) testing, and certification services.
content: SIRIM QAS International, Malaysia’s leading testing, inspection and certification body, is set to play a vital role in the electric vehicles (EV) industry via its electric vehicle charging system (EVCS) testing, and certification services.

title: Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election: Ng Sze Han appointed as PH election director
summary: SHAH ALAM (April 7): Selangor DAP secretary Ng Sze Han has been appointed as the Pakatan Harapan (PH) election director for the Kuala Kubu Baharu state seat by-election on May 11.
content:
SHAH ALAM (April 7): Selangor DAP secretary Ng Sze Han has been appointed as the Pakatan Harapan (PH) election director for the Kuala Kubu Baharu state seat by-election on May 11. 

Selangor PH secretary Dr Mohd Khairudin Othman said Ng's appointment was decided at a state PH leadership joint meeting on Sunday.

Mohd Khairudin said the State Investment, Trade and Mobility Committee chairman (Ng) will be assisted by Puchong Member of Parliament (MP) Yeo B

title: Cover Story: Driving Penang’s digital transformation
summary: In 2018, the Penang government unveiled its Penang2030 vision for a family-focused, green and smart state. One of the foundational projects for achieving this is Digital Penang, a state government-linked agency whose aim is to create a connected, creative and competitive society. Central to this ...
content:
This article first appeared in Digital Edge, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on April 8, 2024 - April 14, 2024

In 2018, the Penang government unveiled its Penang2030 vision for a family-focused, green and smart state. One of the foundational projects for achieving this is Digital Penang, a state government-linked agency whose aim is to create a connected, creative and competitive society. Central to this is its role as a catalyst for accelerating the state’s digital transformatio

title: BoJ governor lauded for smooth policy change
summary: TOKYO: Tomorrow will mark one year since Bank of Japan (BoJ) governor Kazuo Ueda took office.
content:
Capable hands: Ueda speaks during a press conference in Tokyo. He is the central bank’s first post-war governor from an academic background. — AFP

TOKYO: Tomorrow will mark one year since Bank of Japan (BoJ) governor Kazuo Ueda took office.

Market players have praised his skill in ending 11 years of massive monetary easing, but the key point of this exit is still to come. The next move, including additional interest rate hikes, will be a focus of

title: New appointments set to guide Invictus Blue’s integrated proposition
summary: PETALING JAYA: Invictus Blue, which is Asia’s first media agency, has appointed Tan Sri Norza Zakaria as its chairman of its advisory board to guide the agency through to its next phase of growth.
content:
Advisory board chairman Tan Sri Mohamad Norza Zakaria

PETALING JAYA: Invictus Blue, which is Asia’s first media agency, has appointed Tan Sri Norza Zakaria as its chairman of its advisory board to guide the agency through to its next phase of growth.

The interim advisory board is led by Datuk Shafri Mohamad, who has won awards from the New York Film Festival, Clio, Cannes, and was Golden Kancil Best of the Best Grand Prix winner.

Also on the board

title: Japan household spending down 0.5% in February
summary: TOKYO: Consumption spending by households comprising two or more members in Japan in February averaged 279,868 yen, falling 0.5% from a year before in price-adjusted real terms, internal affairs ministry data show.
content:
TOKYO: Consumption spending by households comprising two or more members in Japan in February averaged 279,868 yen, falling 0.5% from a year before in price-adjusted real terms, internal affairs ministry data show.

Although spending dropped for the 12th straight month, the margin of decline narrowed from 6.3% in January due to the leap year. Without the factor, the rate of decline stood at 2.7%.

By category, gas, electricity and water bills fell 18.6%. Electrici

title: Cautious outlook for Velesto on possible DCR fall
summary: PETALING JAYA: CGS International Research has downgraded Velesto Energy Bhd from an “add” to a “hold” as it foresees a possible drop in daily charter rates (DCRs) and utilisation rates in the South-East Asia region as a result of the recent suspension of rig contracts by Saudi Aramco.

title: Soaring coffee bean prices grind local business owners’ profits
summary: JAKARTA: Coffee roasteries and cafe owners are grousing as bean prices reach record highs amid falling harvest outputs and strong demand from consumers, with some local businesses feeling the grind in their profits.
content:
FILE PHOTO: A worker selects coffee beans during harvest on a farm in the municipality of Espírito Santo do Pinhal on May 18, 2012 REUTERS/Nacho Doce/File Photo

JAKARTA: Coffee roasteries and cafe owners are grousing as bean prices reach record highs amid falling harvest outputs and strong demand from consumers, with some local businesses feeling the grind in their profits.

title: Singapore retail sales increase 8.4% in February
summary: SINGAPORE: Retail sales were well up in February to record their second straight month of gains.
content:
Pedestrians along Orchard Road in Singapore. — Bloomberg

SINGAPORE: Retail sales were well up in February to record their second straight month of gains.

Takings at the till rose 8.4% over February 2023 and came after a 1.6% rise year-on-year in January, noted the Department of Statistics on April 5.

If motor vehicles were excluded, sales were up 9.4%, reversing the 1.8% decrease in January, with half of retail categories experiencing a ri

summary: JAKARTA: The Communications and Information Ministry says Elon Musk’s SpaceX has obtained the necessary permit to operate Starlink satellite Internet service and is cleared to roll out test runs in Nusantara Capital City in May.
content:
The Merah Putih 2, a satellite made by French-Italian joint venture Thales Alenia Space on an order placed by state-owned telecommunication firm PT Telkom, is envisioned in this undated artist’s illustration. title: Taiwan quake may push up 2Q memory chip prices
summary: TAIPEI: The powerful earthquake that hit semiconductor powerhouse Taiwan last week may push up chip prices temporarily, according to market watchers.
content:
TAIPEI: The powerful earthquake that hit semiconductor powerhouse Taiwan last week may push up chip prices temporarily, according to market watchers.

On April 3, an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.4 struck off the east coast of the island, home to 18% of global chip manufacturing capacity and where approximately 92% of the world’s advanced semiconductors are produced, putting the tech industry on edge.

Following the quake, TSMC, the world’s largest contract chi

title: Vietnam lenders required to maintain loan standards
summary: HANOI: The central bank is calling on lenders to facilitate access to capital for businesses, while also maintaining lending standards to ensure the safety of credit amid low demand.

Key role: Bank employees (left) deal with customers at a bank branch in Hanoi. The central bank will monitor lenders that have a huge disparity between deposit and lending rates as part of its policy to support firms to access capital. — AFP

HANOI: The central bank is calling on lenders to facilitate access to capital for businesses, while also maintaining lending standards to ensure the safety of credit amid low demand.

title: Hospitality sector revival to benefit IOIProp
summary: PETALING JAYA: IOI Properties Group Bhd (IOIProp) is expected to enjoy a sharp turnaround in the hospitality segment on the back of anticipated higher sales from its hotel room inventory expansion by 64% this year and higher room rates following room refurbishment work.
content: PETALING JAYA: IOI Properties Group Bhd (IOIProp) is expected to enjoy a sharp turnaround in the hospitality segment on the back of anticipated higher sales from its hotel room inventory expansion by 64% this year and higher room rates following room refurbishment w

title: Microsoft names Laurence Si as managing director of its Malaysian ops
summary: PETALING JAYA: Microsoft has announced the appointment of Laurence Si as the managing director for its operations in Malaysia, effective July 1, 2024.
content:
FILE PHOTO: Microsoft logo is seen near computer motherboard in this illustration taken January 8, 2024. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo

PETALING JAYA: Microsoft has announced the appointment of Laurence Si as the managing director for its operations in Malaysia, effective July 1, 2024.

He will assume the operational responsibilities from K Raman whose new role will be announced on July 1.

title: Shoe logo issue: Eight police reports received so far, says IGP
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Eight police reports have been received nationwide so far, regarding the logo of a well-known shoe company allegedly resembling the word “Allah” on its shoe soles.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Eight police reports have been received nationwide so far, regarding the logo of a well-known shoe company allegedly resembling the word “Allah” on its shoe soles.

Inspector-General of Police (IGP) Tan Sri Razarudin Husain said an investigation paper has been opened to probe the matter under Section 298 of the Penal Code and Section 233 of the Communications and Multimedia Act 1998.

title: Kedah’s ministry receives 10 complaints pertaining to the supply and sale of cooking oil
summary: SUNGAI PETANI (April 7): The Kedah Ministry of Domestic Trade and Cost of Living has received 10 complaints regarding the supply of cooking oil for the period between March 12 and Sunday.
content:
SUNGAI PETANI (April 7): The Kedah Ministry of Domestic Trade and Cost of Living has received 10 complaints regarding the supply of cooking oil for the period between March 12 and Sunday.

Its director Muhammad Nizam Jamaludin said of this number, three complaints each were received from the Alor Setar, Sungai Petani and Baling areas, and one from the Kulim area.

"However, only three complaints were acted upon and these involved the offences of hoarding controlle

title: Council’s task force urges Bernas to announce ceiling price for imported white rice
summary: TAIPING (April 7): Padiberas Nasional Bhd (Bernas) has been urged to announce the ceiling price for imported white rice (BPI) to the public.
content:
TAIPING (April 7): Padiberas Nasional Bhd (Bernas) has been urged to announce the ceiling price for imported white rice (BPI) to the public.

Chairman of the National Action Council on Cost of Living (Naccol) task force (food cluster) Datuk Syed Abu Hussin Hafiz Syed Abdul Fasal said the price of BPI is uncertain, as it varies according to the brands.

He said the announcement ensures that consumers know the prices ranging from RM36 to RM65, even though the BPI gr

title: Police extend remand of detained Israeli man with six pistols
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): The remand order on an Israeli man who was detained with six pistols has been extended for another seven days from Sunday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): The remand order on an Israeli man who was detained with six pistols has been extended for another seven days from Sunday.

Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Husain said the extension for Shalom Avitan's remand, which was due to end on Sunday, is to allow the police time to finalise a detailed investigation report.

“We still require some time to gather all firm evidence related to this main suspect (Shalom) and the local marrie

title: Shoe company Vern’s apologises over controversial logo
summary: KUALA LUMPUR  (April 7): Shoe manufacturer Vern’s Holding Sdn Bhd has apologised over the logo that appears on the soles of some of the shoes sold by the company that allegedly resembles the word "Allah" in Arabic.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR  (April 7): Shoe manufacturer Vern’s Holding Sdn Bhd has apologised over the logo that appears on the soles of some of the shoes sold by the company that allegedly resembles the word "Allah" in Arabic.

In a media statement on Sunday, the company clarified that it had absolutely no intention of coming out with a logo that sought to belittle or insult any religion or belief.

The logo, it said, was "100% inspired" by the image of interconnected li

title: Two MMEA personnel injured after being shot in Kunak waters
summary: LAHAD DATU (April 7): Two Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA) Lahad Datu Zone personnel were injured in a shooting incident in Kunak waters at 8.40am on Sunday.
content:
LAHAD DATU (April 7): Two Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA) Lahad Datu zone personnel were injured in a shooting incident in Kunak waters at 8.40am on Sunday.

MMEA Lahad Datu maritime zone director Maritime Commander Dr Suzanna Razali Chan said maritime petty officer Zainal Abad Komel, 45, was injured in the right eye and maritime leading rate Prayrie De Cuella Jimin, 35, was injured in both hands.

She said that at the time of the incident, a team of

title: Teo: MCMC removed 1,454 social media contents related to 3R issues from January to March 2024
summary: KULAI (April 7): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC), in collaboration with social media platforms, removed 1,454 contents touching on issues of race, religion and royalty (3R) between January and March this year.
content:
KULAI (April 7): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC), in collaboration with social media platforms, removed 1,454 contents touching on issues of race, religion and royalty (3R) between January and March this year.

Deputy Communications Minister Teo Nie Ching said of the total, hate speech related to religion was the highest at 727, followed by racial issues (588) and the royal institution (139).

"Last year, MCMC removed a total of 1,633

title: Contaminated mussels: Melaka Fisheries Dept to continue monitoring situation, says exco
summary: JASIN (April 7): The Melaka Department of Fisheries (DOF) is proactively monitoring and taking preventive measures following the discovery of harmful species of algae in water samples and mussels in Sebatu, here.
content:
JASIN (April 7): The Melaka Department of Fisheries (DOF) is proactively monitoring and taking preventive measures following the discovery of harmful species of algae in water samples and mussels in Sebatu, here.

State Rural Development, Agriculture and Food Security Committee chairman Dr Muhamad Akmal Saleh said the sale of clams and mussels in Melaka was temporarily stopped from Friday (April 5), and he also issued a ban on collecting mussels or clams in the state waters.

title: Mohd Na'im instructs Jakim to obtain explanation on alleged ‘Allah’ logoed shoes
summary: PUTRAJAYA (April 7): Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Dr Mohd Na'im Mokhtar has instructed the Department of Islamic Development Malaysia (Jakim) to seek an explanation on Monday (April 8) from the relevant party regarding a purported shoe logo resembling the word "Allah".
content:
PUTRAJAYA (April 7): Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Dr Mohd Na'im Mokhtar has instructed the Department of Islamic Development Malaysia (Jakim) to seek an explanation on Monday (April 8) from the relevant party regarding a purported shoe logo resembling the word "Allah".

Referring to the images of the shoe logo circulating on social media, he emphasised that the Prime Minister's Department for Religious Affairs would not compromise with any party proven to have

title: Contaminated mussels: Negeri Sembilan govt to study impact on fishermen, entrepreneurs
summary: SEREMBAN (April 7): The Negeri Sembilan government will study the impact of the biotoxin contamination case on the mussel farming industry in Port Dickson before taking appropriate measures to help affected fishermen and entrepreneurs.
content:
SEREMBAN (April 7): The Negeri Sembilan government will study the impact of the biotoxin contamination case on the mussel farming industry in Port Dickson before taking appropriate measures to help affected fishermen and entrepreneurs.

Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Aminuddin Harun said the state government always pays attention to entrepreneurs and fishermen, especially after Singapore took action to impose limitations on the distribution and purchase of mussels from Port Dickson

title: Better sugary income for MSM Malaysia on improved exports, industry restructuring: MIDF Research
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: MSM Malaysia Holdings Bhd is poised to record better revenue in financial year 2024 (FY24) until FY26 supported by higher export's sales volume which is expected to grow by two-fold to nearly 400,000 tonnes. MIDF Research stated in a ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: MSM Malaysia Holdings Bhd is poised to record better revenue in financial year 2024 (FY24) until FY26 supported by higher export's sales volume which is expected to grow by two-fold to nearly 400,000 tonnes. 

MIDF Research stated in a note that revenue of the refined sugar producer will rise at a compound annual growth rate of 12 per cent over the next three years. 

"Reasonably, this is achievable, as the group is banking on higher MSM Johor output and new potential clients particularly from Indonesia a

title: RTS Link operator appoints Khairil Anwar as chairman
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): RTS Operations Pte Ltd (RTSO), the operator of the Johor Bahru-Singapore Rapid Transit System Link (RTS Link) project, has appointed Datuk Khairil Anwar Ahmad as its new chairman, replacing Datuk Mohd Farid Mohd Adnan.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): RTS Operations Pte Ltd (RTSO), the operator of the Johor Bahru-Singapore Rapid Transit System Link (RTS Link) project, has appointed Datuk Khairil Anwar Ahmad as its new chairman, replacing Datuk Mohd Farid Mohd Adnan.

The appointment is effective from March 1, according to a statement issued on Sunday by RTSO, a joint venture between Prasarana Malaysia Bhd (Prasarana) and Singapore rail operator SMRT Corporation Ltd.

Khairil was previous

title: Marea, MPAJ to spur better practices of solid waste separation, provide collection for recycling
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Recycling Alliance (Marea) has partnered with Ampang Jaya Municipal Council (MPAJ) to encourage Ampang Jaya residents to embrace better practices in solid waste separation at source and provide collection for recycling.The launch of the Ampang ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The Malaysian Recycling Alliance (Marea) has partnered with Ampang Jaya Municipal Council (MPAJ) to encourage Ampang Jaya residents to embrace better practices in solid waste separation at source and provide collection for recycling.

The launch of the Ampang Jaya High-Rise Collection Programme saw more than 9,100 households from 23 high-rise residences participating in this collective effort to raise the national recycling rate and reduce waste sent to landfills. 

Through Marea's support, this will deli

title: Nearly 10,000 TNB staff will be on duty during Aidilfitri this year
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Tenaga Nasional Bhd (TNB) has assigned nearly 10,000 employees of various levels along its service chain in 11 states across the peninsula to ensure the stability of electricity supply during the upcoming Aidilfitri celebration.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Tenaga Nasional Bhd (TNB) has assigned nearly 10,000 employees of various levels along its service chain in 11 states across the peninsula to ensure the stability of electricity supply during the upcoming Aidilfitri celebration.

Its president and chief executive officer Datuk Megat Jalaluddin Megat Hassan said that monitoring will also be increased ahead of Aidilfitri, for 72 hours, starting the day before the first day of Syawal, which is critical due to the people making preparations,

title: Ringgit to trade in tight range of 4.72-4.73 versus US dollar next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to trade in a tight range of RM4.72 to RM4.73 against the US dollar in the upcoming holiday-shortened week of trading, said an economist.Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to trade in a tight range of RM4.72 to RM4.73 against the US dollar in the upcoming holiday-shortened week of trading, said an economist.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said Brent crude oil prices were hovering above US$90 per barrel amid concern over geopolitical risks in the Middle East.

He said the foreign exchange market is on defensive mode with demand for safe haven currencies such as the US dollar becoming elevated. The US Dollar Index ro

title: Bursa Malaysia seen to trade sideways next week, with KLCI in 1,537-1,570 range
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is likely to remain in sideways pattern next week, with an upside bias seen for the FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI).Nonetheless, the longer outlook remains positive, said Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is likely to remain in sideways pattern next week, with an upside bias seen for the FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI).

Nonetheless, the longer outlook remains positive, said Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng.

"We uphold our view that if the benchmark index were to breach the 1,557 resistance level and sustain it over an extended period, there will be further upside potential.

"The FBM KLCI staged a rebound and formed a long white candle on Thursday plu

title: Tesla's bet on robotaxis is a long way from paying off
summary: Tesla is making a risky bet if it shifts efforts on its small-car vehicle platform to robotaxis as the successful introduction of vehicles that drive themselves is in the distant future, and the technology faces engineering and regulatory hurdles.Reuters ...
content:
Tesla is making a risky bet if it shifts efforts on its small-car vehicle platform to robotaxis as the successful introduction of vehicles that drive themselves is in the distant future, and the technology faces engineering and regulatory hurdles.

Reuters reported on Friday that Tesla has canceled its planned low-cost car and instead will continue developing self-driving robotaxis on the same platform. Musk replied via a post on his X.com platform that "Reuters is lying (again)." He did not identify any specific inaccuracies.</

title: Berjaya Air eyes 6% y-o-y revenue growth with new aircraft, destinations
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Berjaya Land Bhd’s aviation arm Berjaya Air Sdn Bhd (BAir) is aiming for a 6% revenue growth year-on-year (y-o-y) in the next five years, supported by two new turboprop aircraft, capacity expansion and possible new routes, both in Malaysia and the region.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Berjaya Land Bhd’s aviation arm Berjaya Air Sdn Bhd (BAir) is aiming for a 6% revenue growth year-on-year (y-o-y) in the next five years, supported by two new turboprop aircraft, capacity expansion and possible new routes, both in Malaysia and the region.

Speaking to Bernama, BAir general manager Mohd Amri Mohd Akib said the carrier is considering capacity expansion, particularly to destinations where Berjaya owns resorts such as Langkawi and Penang.

title: Malaysian civil society, media unite to launch #MZB365 movement
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Civil society and media organisations in Malaysia have joined hands to introduce the #MZB365 movement aimed at combatting ethno-religious hate speech and promoting forgiveness.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Civil society and media organisations in Malaysia have joined hands to introduce the #MZB365 movement aimed at combatting ethno-religious hate speech and promoting forgiveness. 

The initiative aims to encourage Malaysians to embrace the practice of seeking and giving forgiveness every day of the year.

The #MZB365 movement stands for "Maaf Zahir Batin Hari-Hari” (seeking and giving forgiveness every day) and emphasises the importance

title: ABB plans to expand footprint in Malaysia, driving energy transition aspiration
summary: KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Swedish-Swiss electrification and automation leader ABB Ltd is looking into expanding its footprint in Malaysia through partnerships in supporting key projects.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Swedish-Swiss electrification and automation leader ABB Ltd is looking into expanding its footprint in Malaysia through partnerships in supporting key projects. 

ABB’s Asia pesident for the energy industries Anders Maltesen said the multinational is currently supporting several key projects in Malaysia, including Batang Ai, the Petronas liquefied natural gas (PFLNG) 2 floating liquefied natural gas (FLNG) facility, and Malaysia’s biggest crude oil refinery in Melaka, amon

title: Tiong: Parti Sarawak Bersatu dissolved, Wong appointed as Progressive Democratic Party senior VP
summary: SIBU (April 6): Datuk Seri Wong Soon Koh and two senior leaders of the now-dissolved Parti Sarawak Bersatu (PSB) have taken up top positions in the Progressive Democratic Party (PDP), it was announced on Saturday.
content:
SIBU (April 6): Datuk Seri Wong Soon Koh and two senior leaders of the now-dissolved Parti Sarawak Bersatu (PSB) have taken up top positions in the Progressive Democratic Party (PDP), it was announced on Saturday. 

PDP president Datuk Seri Tiong King Sing, who is also Bintulu Member of Pariiament, said the appointment of Wong — the former PSB president who is also Bawang Assan assemblyman, as well as state assemblymen Engkilili and Dr Johnical Rayong Ngipa; and Baru Bian — who is state

title: Perfect 10
summary: One of the greatest rugby players in history, Dan Carter is a bona fide legend, having played for close to two decades, racking up over 100 Test matches for New Zealand, winning two Rugby World Cups, and being crowned top international points scorer in Test Rugby with a tally of 1,598 points and most-capped All Blacks fly-half of all time in the process.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): One of the greatest rugby players in history, Dan Carter is a bona fide legend, having played for close to two decades, racking up over 100 Test matches for New Zealand, winning two Rugby World Cups, and being crowned top international points scorer in Test Rugby with a tally of 1,598 points and most-capped All Blacks fly-half of all time in the process.

title: Forging ahead for growth
summary: Mah Sing Group Bhd plans to bulk up its property investment portfolio with industrial assets for more recurring income and expand its plastic manufacturing business into other Asean countries. Founder and group managing director Tan Sri Leong Hoy Kum also intends to list its plastic and rubber glove manufacturing segments soon.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 7): Mah Sing Group Bhd plans to bulk up its property investment portfolio with industrial assets for more recurring income and expand its plastic manufacturing business into other Asean countries. Founder and group managing director Tan Sri Leong Hoy Kum also intends to list its plastic and rubber glove manufacturing segments soon.

“To have recurring income, we are looking at data centres. We have suitable land in Bangi and Sepang where there is sufficient electricity supply and green energ

title: 15pc dividend distribution
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bank Rakyat Group declared a dividend distribution of 15 per cent, totaling RM424.62 million for the financial year ending on December 31, 2023 (FY23).The banking firm reported a 3.80 per cent growth in profit before tax and zakat (PBTZ) to RM1.76 ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bank Rakyat Group declared a dividend distribution of 15 per cent, totaling RM424.62 million for the financial year ending on December 31, 2023 (FY23).

The banking firm reported a 3.80 per cent growth in profit before tax and zakat (PBTZ) to RM1.76 billion for FY23 from RM1.70 billion the year before.

Bank Rakyat attributed this growth to its robust fundamentals and focused efforts on its core activities.

The group said in a statement yesterday that it remained watchful despite challenges in the bankin
